title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1727-4.1 - Rent schedules
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1727-4.1 - Rent schedules

State Regulations
(a) Rents
or carrying charges are determined by reference to rent schedules approved by
the division, pursuant to subdivision (c) of this section and the surcharge
schedule shown in subdivision (d) of this section. (b) After ascertaining probable aggregate
annual family income, less permissible deductions, reference to these
schedules, as applicable, will show rent to be charged. (c) Rent schedules are prepared by the
housing company, subject to division approval, provided that if such approval
is not issued within 90 days from submission of all required materials, such
schedules shall be deemed approved. Such schedules should provide sufficient
income to meet the costs of efficient project operation, including reasonable
reserves and debt service. (d) Unless the division has ordered otherwise, the following schedule shall be used
to determine surcharge rentals: Income

Rental
(in percent of
current maximum admission limit for apartment)
(in percent of
current admission rental for apartment)

Greater
than

Up to and
including

Limited profit
and limited dividends

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
